content:
The Act titled "Department of Veterans Affairs Expiring Authorities Act of 2013" extends certain authorities affecting veterans and their families, including providing a monthly assistance allowance to disabled veterans invited by the United States Olympic Committee. The Act extends assistance for disabled veterans invited by the United States Olympic Committee until December 31, 2013. The Act extends assistance for disabled veterans invited by the United States Olympic Committee until December 31, 2013. Amendments are made to the section, including changing references from "United States Paralympics, Inc." to "United States Olympic Committee" and adding a new subsection regarding applicability to Commonwealths and Territories of the United States. The provisions of this section apply to various National Olympic Committees, including American Samoa, Guam, Puerto Rico, and other entities representing the interests of the Northern Mariana Islands and the United States Virgin Islands. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in the title. The table of sections in chapter 5 is amended by replacing the item for section 521A with a new item. Section 521A provides assistance for the United States Olympic Committee. The authority for collection of copayments for hospital and nursing home care, recovery from third parties for care costs, and homeless veterans reintegration programs have been extended to September 30, 2014 and October 1, 2014 respectively. The authority for collection of copayments for hospital and nursing home care, recovery from third parties for care costs, and homeless veterans reintegration programs have been extended to September 30, 2014 and October 1, 2014 respectively. Section 2023(d) of the title is amended to provide referral and counseling services for veterans at risk of homelessness transitioning from certain institutions. Section 2013 of the title is also amended to extend comprehensive service programs affecting homeless veterans. The funding for supportive services for very low-income veteran families in permanent housing is increased to $250,000,000 for fiscal year 2014 and $150,000,000 for fiscal year 2015 and beyond. Additionally, the grant program for homeless veterans with special needs is extended through 2014. The eligibility for Specially Adapted Housing Assistance for certain disabled veterans is extended through September 30, 2014, with a limit of 30 applications approved in fiscal year 2014. Extension of Authority To Calculate Net Value of Real Property Securing Defaulted Loan for Purposes of Liquidation is extended to October 1, 2014. The Pilot Program on Assistance for Child Care for Certain Veterans Receiving Health Care is extended to a 3-year duration. SEC. 3. REAUTHORIZATION OF USE OF NATIONAL DIRECTORY OF NEW HIRES FOR INCOME VERIFICATION PURPOSES FOR CERTAIN VETERANS BENEFITS. Amendment made to the Social Security Act regarding the expiration of authority under a specific paragraph. The authority under Section 5317A of title 38, United States Code, is amended to specify two periods of effect: from December 26, 2007, to November 18, 2011, and from the date of the enactment of the Department of Veterans Affairs Expiring Authorities Act of 2013 to 180 days after that date. SEC. 4. EFFECTIVE DATE AND RATIFICATION. This Act shall take effect on October 1, 2013, with Section 2 (a) effective on September 30, 2013. Actions by the Department of Veterans Affairs under the extended authorities will be ratified if the Act is not enacted by September 30, 2013. The budgetary effects of this Act will be determined by reference to the latest statement for compliance with the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010, submitted by the Chairman of the Senate Budget Committee before the vote on passage.
